ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Knowledge of the real economy, financial markets, and monetary policy in an international context. There are unique barriers and heterogeneities between countries, which is what makes this class fun and challenging!

I am more familiar with the main models in international economics and have a deeper understanding of the main issues in this field. In addition, I have accumulated a lot of classic literature in the field by following the requirment.
skills that I have made progress: critical thinking, literature reading ability

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strength: lots of interesting papers and discussions in class. The presentations by students was a highlight for me. The professor is very enthusiastic and inspired me to work hard in the class!

Weakness: there was initially some confusion as to the precise deadlines for assignments. That got cleared up quickly though.

Strengths: In comparison to the courses I've taken before, I believe this course has significantly deepened my understanding of the underlying assumptions and variations in economic models. And surprisingly, the course content is closely intertwined with real-world applications, enabling me to gain a more profound comprehension of global economic operations.

One potential suggestion: I find this course quite challenging, particularly due to the abundance of complex reading materials, so maybe there can be some gradient for the reading.
strengths: I can read lots of excellent papers and have further discussion with teacher and other students.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! Prof Ramirez is inspiring because he has both knowledge and passion for the field of economics. He pushed me to think deeply about the topics we learned, and now I plan to further study international econ thanks to this class. Note that it's a seminar - the participation component is very important.
Yes! The close integration of this course with real-world applications has sparked an unprecedented interest in economics within me.

Yes. 
Although the pace of the course is fast and the tasks are challenging, my critical thinking and literature reading ability have improved. International economic theory and real economic phenomena are well combined in this class.

narratives.question_text: The Canvas course site allowed me to identify and access required course materials easily.
How will you use the knowledge and skills you learned in this course in your future endeavors?
comments: I may pursue a graduate degree in economics, in which case the models and papers we discussed in this paper will be of great assistance. If I go into a career that involves studying economics, the understanding of international markets from this class will be very helpful as well.

I will possibly draw upon the course content when pondering questions related to international trade and exchange rates. Additionally, this course has enhanced my reading skills, enabling me to systematically accumulate knowledge from similar literature in the future.
I will try to make the empirical part of my study more persuasive by using the techniques and way of writing that he told us in class.

extras.title: ECON S328 01 - Topics in Int'l Economics
